intro: Ceratoxalis coloradensis, commonly known as the Colorado cliffbrake, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Ephedraceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing form. The plant features small, scale-like leaves that are typically green or reddish in color, depending on the season. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
